p: The model forecast indicated that at present, the highly suitable habitat of T. matsutake is mainly located in east-central South Korea and central Japan. By the 2050s, highly suitable habitat has largely disappeared; in Japan, it is extensively reduced and shifted northward. By the 2070s, highly suitable habitat appears in east-central North Korea, and in Japan, it continues to decrease and move north. Over time, the suitable habitat of T. matsutake in South Korea and Japan declines sharply and shifts to high-latitude areas, whereas in North Korea, the range of suitable habitat gradually increases. The marginal habitat of T. matsutake under climate change in the whole area remains largely stable, with the boundary shifted northward. By the 2070s, little area of marginal habitat appears in Russia.
